name: Review API Contract
description: Comprehensive review of M2 API contract implementation. Verify all API endpoints, request/response DTOs, Swagger documentation, error handling, and validation rules against PRD specifications. Ensure compliance with ADR decisions for versioning, response contract design, and Swagger standards. Validate that the API surface is production-ready, consistent, and fully documented.

agent.role: API contract review specialist - M2 quality gate before DoD verification

sections: Section 11: Request/Response Contracts - API contract structure
Section 11.2: Response Contract - Classification-Specific (Expense XOR Other)
Section 10: Parsing Rules - Validation requirements and error codes
requirements: Single endpoint: POST /api/v1/parse with correct versioning
Response MUST be expense XOR other (never both)
All responses include correlation ID for traceability
Request DTOs properly validated with FluentValidation
Error responses follow standard structure with clear error codes
Swagger UI provides interactive documentation with examples
API contract matches specification exactly (no drift)

test_brief_reference.requirement: API contract must be well-documented, testable, and production-ready
test_brief_reference.grading_criteria: API design quality, documentation completeness, error handling clarity

adr_references.decision: Swagger/OpenAPI for API documentation and contract specification
adr_references.rationale: Interactive documentation, single source of truth, review-friendly
adr_references.context: Swagger UI at /swagger with complete endpoint documentation
adr_references.key_excerpt: Annotate API endpoints and DTOs with XML comments and attributes. Add example schemas using SwaggerOperation and SwaggerResponse attributes.

adr_references.context: Phase 1 uses /api/v1/ pattern for all endpoints
adr_references.key_excerpt: Pattern: /api/v1/, /api/v2/, etc. Include x-api-version header in all responses.

adr_references.rationale: Clear contracts, smaller payloads, type safety via discriminated unions
adr_references.context: Response structure mirrors business reality - content is either expense or other, not both
adr_references.key_excerpt: Each response will include: (1) classification field (enum: expense | other), (2) Classification-specific block (expense OR other, never both), (3) meta block (correlation ID, processing time, warnings)

delivery_plan_reference.requirement: Comprehensive review of API surface before M2 DoD verification

business_rules: API contract MUST match PRD v0.3 specification exactly
Response structure MUST be expense XOR other (ADR-0007)
All responses MUST include correlation ID for traceability
Error codes MUST be standardized (MISSING_TOTAL, UNCLOSED_TAGS, MALFORMED_XML)
Swagger UI MUST be accessible and functional in development
No breaking changes introduced without explicit approval
All contract tests MUST be passing before approval

quality_gates: All contract tests pass (10+ tests green)
API builds and runs without errors
No DTO field mismatches with specification
Error handling is comprehensive and consistent
review_methodology: Compare DTOs against PRD Section 11 line-by-line

Verify error scenarios return correct codes and structure
Review contract test coverage for completeness
Verify DI registration by checking app startup logs
